Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior glazed; exterior: on shoulder, part of band of alternating red and black tongues lined in dilute; below, two bands; below, black-figure decoration consisting of horses ridden to right; on left, nose, mouth, beard and shoulder of horseman and bridled horse’s head (red on neck); ro right, tail and rump (possibly with red) of horse.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.580.c. See Williams for an objection to attribution to the painter himself (Williams 1983, 33). See also Moore, M. B. 'Horses on Black-Figured Greek Vases of the Archaic Period: ca. 620-480 BC', Ph.D. diss., New York University 1972, 26, no. A96 and Bakir, G., Sophilos. Ein Beitrag zu seinem Stil. Mainz 1981, 66, no. A7, fig. 123. British Museum 1888,0601.580.c was excavated from the Sanctuary of Aphrodite. In all likelihood, this sherd most likely came from the same area, despite the fact that no specific provenance was given for it.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.14.2)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 256, no. 9)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 290, no. B268)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 149, note 54, 2)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 9b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0249) (Phase 1)
